Travel Guide Maseru 2024 - Is it worth visiting?

First time here? Find out how we rate and rank destinations.

Is Maseru worth visiting in 2024?

With around 56 out of 100 overall points, the destination Maseru has rather less outstanding features for 2024 compared to other cities and is ranked at number 2524.

In the context of budget considerations, trips to Maseru are rather affordable. In Maseru, the number of attractions is rather low in relation to the population size, which makes a visit conditionally worthwhile. Maseru carries a significant safety risk, especially in certain areas, and travelers should exercise heightened caution to ensure a more secure experience.

The destination Maseru is characterized as less developed and less well equipped for visitors. There is a rather low risk of overtourism in Maseru, even in high season, so a pleasant travel experience is almost always possible.

You can find more in-depth details on the ratings for the price level, attractions, safety and infrastructure categories in the corresponding sections on this page. The assessment presented here is based solely on data. The assessment of whether the destination Maseru is "worth visiting" for you is subjective and depends on your individual preferences and interests.

If you're not quite sure whether Maseru is the best destination for you, take a look at other cities in the Africa region. Alternatively, you can also take a look at the country profile of Lesotho. You can also easily find the best cities in the world according to your preferences with the city filter tool.

Facts about Maseru

Maseru is the capital city of Lesotho. It is known for its rich cultural heritage and historical significance. The city is home to various ethnic groups, each with their own unique traditions and customs. Sesotho is the most widely spoken language in Maseru, although English is also spoken and understood by many residents. The number of permanent residents in Maseru is around 330,000.

Best time to visit Maseru

The main tourist season in Maseru is during the months of October to April. This is when the weather is warm and dry, making it ideal for outdoor activities and sightseeing.

The rainy season in Maseru occurs from May to September. During this time, the city experiences frequent rainfall, which can sometimes disrupt outdoor plans and make certain areas inaccessible.

The best time to visit Maseru is during the transitional periods before and after the main season. There are fewer tourists on site and the crowds are smaller. The price level is better than in the high season, while the weather conditions are still good.

When it comes to the optimum combination of pleasant local temperatures with the lowest possible rainfall, a good time to visit Maseru is January through April and September through December. During this specific time Maseru receives a monthly average of 19 dry days and 11 days with a total precipitation of 1,6 inch (41 mm). Overall, throughout the year, Maseru gets a monthly average of 22 dry days and 8 days with a total precipation of 1,1 inch (28 mm). The average monthly day temperature for Maseru is 68 Â°F (20 Â°C) and the night temperature is 47 Â°F (8 Â°C).

How many days to stay in Maseru?

The length of your stay in Maseru depends largely on your preferences, the purpose of your visit and the sights you really want to see. Your time frame can also be influenced by financial considerations.

For first-time visitors, it is recommended to spend around 1 day in Maseru. This will give you enough time to visit many of the main attractions on your own or with organized tours nearby Maseru. How long you should stay ultimately depends on what you expect from your trip and how intensively you want to explore Maseru. If you want to take it slow or relax, you should plan a few more days.

You can use our travel budget calculator for Maseru to work out a rough budget for the length of your stay based on your personal travel preferences. Simply use the $ symbol in the tool section at the top right of this page.

How to get to Maseru

The most popular ways for visitors to get to Maseru are the following options:

Air: There are flights available from Johannesburg to Moshoeshoe I International Airport in Maseru.

Bus: There are bus services available from Johannesburg to Ladybrand nearby Maseru, which takes around 8 hours.

Taxi: Taxis are available from the border crossing points between South Africa and Lesotho to Maseru.

If you are traveling by plane, compare prices for transfers from the airport in Bloemfontein to your final destination. Use the flight calendar below to find out the cheapest month to fly to Lesotho to discover Maseru. How to get around in Maseru?

The most common ways to get around in Maseru are:

Taxi: Taxis are widely available in Maseru and are a popular way to get around the city.

Minibus: Minibus taxis are also available and provide a convenient way to get around the city.

Walking: Walking is also an option for getting around in Maseru, as many of the city's destinations are within walking distance of each other.

If you want to move around independently and freely, it's best to compare prices for rental cars at the airport in Bloemfontein.

If you are not only interested in the city of Maseru, but the whole country, take a look at organized multi-day tours and trips in Lesotho. An organized trip offers several advantages that can improve your travel experience. You save yourself a lot of time and effort in preparing and carrying out the trip. You also have expert tour guides with you to explain everything to you.

Do I need cash in Maseru?

The official currency of Lesotho is the Lesotho loti (LSL), which is pegged to the South African rand (ZAR) at a 1:1 ratio. Cash is widely accepted in Maseru, and it is recommended to carry some local currency for small purchases and transactions. Credit and debit cards are also accepted at many establishments, particularly in larger hotels, restaurants, and shops. However, it is advisable to carry cash as backup, as some smaller businesses may not accept cards or may have limited card payment facilities. Overall, while both cash and cards are accepted, cash is the preferred type of payment in Maseru.
